name: lateness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of happening or arriving after the planned, expected, usual, or necessary time: He was fired from his job for persistent lateness. Sorry for the lateness of my reply.
the fact of being near the end of the day: It was no great surprise that you were tired given the lateness of the hour. I'm sorry for the lateness of the call, but I need to speak to you urgently. See
late
More examplesFewer examplesThe coach doesn't accept excuses for lateness.Repeated lateness will result in disciplinary action.We apologise for the lateness of the train approaching Platform One.Despite the lateness of the evening, he was wearing sunglasses.
